title: Interview Tips for Graduates and Professionals
description: Comprehensive guide to excel in job interviews and advance your career

tips.title: Company Research
tips.description: Thoroughly research the company, role, and industry
details: Study company website, mission, and values
Research recent news and developments
Understand the job description and requirements
Know the company's competitors and market position
Research the interviewer's background on LinkedIn

tips.title: Technical Preparation
tips.description: Prepare for technical questions and assessments
details: Review fundamental concepts in your field
Practice coding problems (for tech roles)
Prepare case studies (for consulting/business roles)
Update knowledge of latest industry trends
Practice technical presentations if required

tips.title: Behavioral Questions
tips.description: Prepare STAR method responses for common questions
details: Tell me about yourself
Why do you want this job?
Describe a challenging situation you handled
What are your strengths and weaknesses?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

tips.title: Effective Communication
details: Maintain eye contact and good posture
Speak clearly and at appropriate pace
Listen actively to questions
Ask clarifying questions if needed
Use specific examples to support your answers

tips.title: Professional Presentation
details: Dress appropriately for the company culture
Arrive 10-15 minutes early
Bring multiple copies of your resume
Turn off mobile phone
Show enthusiasm and genuine interest

tips.title: Asking Questions
tips.description: Prepare thoughtful questions to ask the interviewer
details: What does success look like in this role?
What are the biggest challenges facing the team?
How does the company support professional development?
What is the company culture like?
What are the next steps in the process?

tips: Have your resume and notes ready
Make eye contact with each person
Ask for names and roles at the beginning
Direct answers to the person who asked
Thank each panel member at the end

formats.description: Assessment of technical skills and knowledge
tips: Think out loud while solving problems
Explain your approach step by step
Ask relevant questions to gather information

commonMistakes: Arriving late or too early (more than 15 minutes)
Failing to prepare questions to ask
Not following up after the interview
Being too casual or overly formal
followUp: Send a thank-you email within 24 hours
Reiterate your interest in the position
Address any concerns raised during the interview
Follow up politely if you don't hear back within the stated timeframe
